• Evaluate organ systems clinically using the ESMOE approach: big five (cerebral, cardiovascular, respiratory, liver
and kidney), forgotten four (haematological, immune, endocrine, musculoskeletal, and core one (urogenital).
• Take blood for FBC, U&E and blood culture.
• Insert an intravenous line with crystalloid fluid, e.g. sodium chloride 0.9% and run at 120-240 mL/hour.
• Insert a urinary catheter.
• Ensure that antibiotics are given within one hour of presentation
